intro: Ramium denudatum, commonly known as the naked leek, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a long flowering period, often blooming from late spring to early autumn. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
